p: The diseases affecting blueberry crops in northwestern Michoac√°n, Mexico, cause significant losses in production. This study identified three fungi that are often isolated from plants with symptoms of dieback and cancers: P. clavispora, C. gloeosporioides and L. pseudotheobromae. The first two have already been reported in blueberry crops by other studies [ 26, 27], but we did not find reports of L. pseudotheobromae in blueberry, although it has been reported in other crops [ 28, 29].
